chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Seam extends the CDI programming model into the messaging world by allowing you to inject JMS resources into your beans. Further, Seam bridges the CDI event bus over JMS; this gives you the benefits of CDI-style type-safety for inter-application communication.

section.title: Mission statement
section.para: The missing of the JMS module for Seam 3 is to provide injection of JMS resources and the necessary scaffolding for CDI event propagation over JMS.

section.title: Seam 3 JMS Module Overview
section.para: The general goals can be divided into two categories: injection of JMS resources and forwarding of events:

itemizedlist.title: Forwarding of Events
itemizedlist.listitem: Implicit - use a stereotype annotation when firing events
Explicit - events and qualifiers are registered explicitly
